intro: Platystemon capsularis, commonly known as the Cape mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact, bushy growth habit with linear, grass-like leaves. Platystemon capsularis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
